actions_taken: 16:25 - Investigated metrics, observed 15%+ packet loss spike
16:35 - SSH'd to RouterY, found CRC errors on interface eth2
16:40 - Checked hardware logs, found transceiver errors
16:45 - Identified faulty SFP+ module on RouterY eth2
17:10 - Interface brought back up, no CRC errors
17:20 - Verified traffic recovery and stable metrics
17:35 - Incident closed, RMA initiated for failed module
resolution_summary: Replaced faulty SFP+ optical transceiver on RouterY interface eth2
engineer_notes: Hardware failure of SFP+ module caused significant packet loss and retransmissions (leading to latency). CRC errors on the interface were the smoking gun. Utilization remained low throughout, ruling out congestion. The module was only 8 months old - may be a bad batch. Recommend checking other modules from same vendor/lot.
